title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question.
summary: Hamlet is a tragedy that tells the story of Prince Hamlet avenging his father's death.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
summary: Pride and Prejudice is a romantic novel that explores the themes of love, reputation, and class.

title: The Raven
author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary.
summary: The Raven is a narrative poem that tells the story of a man visited by a mysterious raven.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: To go wrong in one's own way is better than to go right in someone else's.
summary: Crime and Punishment is a psychological novel that explores the moral dilemmas of a young man who commits a crime.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
quote: Sing to me of the man, Muse, the man of twists and turns.
summary: The Odyssey is an epic poem that follows the hero Odysseus on his journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
summary: Frankenstein is a Gothic novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
summary: A Tale of Two Cities is a historical novel set during the French Revolution, exploring themes of sacrifice and redemption.

title: Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
quote: As Gregor Samsa awoke one morning from uneasy dreams he found himself transformed in his bed into a gigantic insect.
summary: Metamorphosis is a novella that tells the story of Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one day to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: Leaves of Grass
author: Walt Whitman
quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
summary: Leaves of Grass is a poetry collection that celebrates the human spirit and the beauty of nature.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.

title: The Glass Menagerie
author: Tennessee Williams
quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
